intro: Peucedanum albostriatum, commonly known as the white-striated cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to Central Asia, this plant thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Its aromatic seeds are used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's structure and growth habits make it a distinctive member of the carrot family.
